samples.source:
the city of eugene in the united states has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 iaaf world championships . 
the decision was taken by the international association of athletics federations council , who decided to bypass the usual bidding process because of what it saw as a ` unique strategic opportunity to host the iaaf world championships for the first time in the usa ' . 
eugene failed last november in its bid to host the 2019 event , which was instead awarded to doha , but a recent presentation to the iaaf persuaded the governing body the city has what it takes to stage a world championships . 
eugene in the united states has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 iaaf world championships
qatar captial doha , home to the aspire dome , beat eugene to host the 2019 event
` in granting the championships to eugene the iaaf council have made a clear choice on a strategic decision that enables us to take advantage of a unique opportunity that may never arise again , whereby public authorities , the private sector , the national olympic committee , nbc and a particularly enthusiastic public are joining forces , ' iaaf president lamine diack said in a statement . 
` although this decision departs from the usual procedure , i am delighted that my council colleagues understood the enormous opportunity presented to us to access a key market and have taken a decision in the interest of the global development of our sport . ' 
the 2007 world championships held in osaka , japan was also awarded without a bidding process . 
mo farah won gold in the men 's 10000 metres during the 2019 iaaf world athletics championships in moscow
samples.summary: The city of Eugene in the United States has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships. This decision was made by the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) Council, who bypassed the usual bidding process due to a strategic opportunity to host the IAAF World Championships for the first time in the USA. Eugene previously failed to host the 2019 event, which was instead awarded to Doha, Qatar. The IAAF Council's decision was based on a recent presentation that convinced them of Eugene's ability to stage a world championships. The 2007 World Championships held in Osaka, Japan, was also awarded without a bidding process. IAAF President Lamine Diack expressed enthusiasm about the decision, stating that it presents a unique opportunity for public authorities, the private sector, the national Olympic committee, NBC, and an enthusiastic public to join forces. This decision departs from the usual procedure, but Diack is pleased that the Council understood the opportunity to access a key market and made a decision in the interest of the global development of the sport.

samples.summary:
Eugene, United States, has been granted the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships, bypassing the usual bidding process due to a unique strategic opportunity. This decision was made by the IAAF Council, who saw the chance to host the event for the first time in the USA. Eugene previously lost the bid to host the 2019 event to Doha, Qatar. The IAAF Council's decision was based on the collaboration between public authorities, the private sector, the national Olympic Committee, NBC, and an enthusiastic public. This is not the first time a championship was awarded without a bidding process, as the 2007 World Championships in Osaka, Japan, was also granted without a bidding process. 

Note: The information about Mo Farah winning gold in the men's 10,000 meters during the 2019 IAAF World Championships in Moscow is not directly related to the passage and has been omitted from the summary.

samples.source:
at the grand old age of 75 , jack nicklaus is still capable of hitting aces . 
the golden bear added another magic moment to his storied career at augusta national in the par-3 contest . 
stepping up to the tee on the 130-yard fourth , the greatest golfer of all time saw his shot sail beyond the flag before spinning back into the hole . 
jack nicklaus gave the crowd something to cheer with a hole in one on the fourth during the par-3 contest
nicklaus holds up his ball to an adoring crowd as gary player ( left ) and ben crenshaw salute the great
crenshaw and nicklaus fist pump following his ace on the 130-yard hole at augusta national
nicklaus was playing alongside gary player and ben crenshaw as the first roar of masters week filled the skies in a sunswept georgia . 
` i had an interview this morning , and i said " well , all i 've got to do is go out and win the par-3 and make a hole and one " , and i make a hole in one , ' nicklaus said afterwards . 
the ace was nicklaus ' first on the hallowed turf of augusta , but the veteran saw his achievement eclipsed by that of camilo villegas on a day which saw five hole-in-ones , levelling the record from 2002 . 
the colombian followed nicklaus with an ace on the fourth and also managed one on the eighth , but he could n't quite land the title , losing out to world no 74 kevin streelman in a play-off . 
nicklaus became the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963 , and collected his sixth in 1986 . 
he is one of five men to complete the career grand slam , an accolade which favourite rory mcilroy can achieve if he wins his third major in succession .
samples.summary: Jack Nicklaus, aged 75, achieved a hole-in-one on the 130-yard fourth hole during the Par-3 Contest at Augusta National. This was his first hole-in-one on the hallowed turf of Augusta. However, his achievement was eclipsed by Camilo Villegas, who also made two holes-in-one during the same event. Villegas made one on the fourth hole like Nicklaus and another on the eighth, but he lost out to Kevin Streelman in a play-off. Jack Nicklaus is a renowned golfer, having won the Masters Tournament six times, including being the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963. He is one of five men to complete the career Grand Slam. Rory McIlroy, a favorite, can achieve this accolade if he wins his third major in succession.

samples.summary: At 75, Jack Nicklaus demonstrated his enduring skill by hitting a hole-in-one during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. On the 130-yard fourth hole, his shot sailed past the flag before spinning back into the hole, thrilling the crowd. Playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, Nicklaus celebrated with a fist pump. This was his first ace at Augusta, though the day saw five hole-in-ones, including two by Camilo Villegas. Nicklaus, who first won a green jacket in 1963 and his sixth in 1986, is one of five men to complete the career grand slam. Rory McIlroy could join this elite group if he wins his third major in succession.

a species of whale that was feared to be extinct has been found washed up on a west australian beach , giving scientists an opportunity to learn more about the mammal . 
the omura 's whale was discovered on a remote exmouth beach , at the tip of the state 's north west cape , after tropical cyclone olwyn tore through the area last month . 
it is the first sighting of the species in wa and only the second in australia . 
identifying the 5.68 m juvenile female was at first difficult for department of parks and wildlife staff , who eventually confirmed it was an omura 's whale with dna profiling . 
an omura 's whale was discovered on a remote exmouth beach in wa ( pictured ) . 
it left authorities confused as they struggled to identify the rare species
environment minister albert jacob said the find was ` highly significant ' for whale scientists because very little was known about the species . 
` omura 's whale was only described in scientific journals for the first time in 2003 and is apparently restricted to tropical and subtropical waters , ' he said . 
` the knowledge we gain from this whale will help to improve field identification guides to better understand the whale 's regional distribution . ' 
the species is usually found in indonesian waters , the philippines and the sea of japan . 
omura 's whales have a sleek body shape and several unique skeletal features , including 53 vertebrae and four digits on each pectoral fin . 
the carcass has been buried and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and possibly for public display in museums . 
the omura 's is usually found in indonesian waters , the philippines and the sea of japan
the whale has a sleek body shape and several unique skeletal features , including 67 vertebrae
samples.summary: A juvenile female Omura's whale, a rare species believed to be restricted to tropical and subtropical waters, was found washed up on a remote Exmouth beach in Western Australia (WA). This is the first sighting of the species in WA and only the second in Australia. The discovery was initially challenging for the Department of Parks and Wildlife staff to identify, but DNA profiling confirmed it as an Omura's whale. The find is significant for whale scientists as very little is known about the species, which is usually found in Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. The carcass has been buried, and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and potential public display in museums.

samples.summary: A species of whale, known as the Omura's whale, which was previously feared to be extinct, has been found washed up on a beach in Western Australia. This discovery provides scientists with an opportunity to learn more about the mammal. It is the first sighting of the species in Western Australia and only the second in Australia. The identification of the whale was initially difficult, but it was eventually confirmed to be an Omura's whale through DNA profiling. This find is considered highly significant for whale scientists, as very little is known about the species. The knowledge gained from this whale will help improve field identification guides and better understand its regional distribution. The Omura's whale is usually found in Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. It has a sleek body shape and several unique skeletal features. The carcass has been buried, and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and possibly for public display in museums.

samples.summary: A species of whale, feared extinct, was found on a West Australian beach, providing scientists a chance to study it. The Omura's whale, discovered on Exmouth beach after Cyclone Olwyn, marks the first sighting in Western Australia and the second in Australia. Initially difficult to identify, it was confirmed through DNA profiling. Environment Minister Albert Jacob highlighted the significance of the find, noting the species was first described in 2003 and is typically found in tropical waters like Indonesia, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. The whale has a sleek body and unique skeletal features. The carcass has been buried, with plans to recover the skeleton for further study and potential museum display.
